result.execSummary:
The defendant Tasha E. Irvine was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant, Tasha E. Irvine appeared with Attorney Samuel Louis Lawton.  Attorney Thomas H Frost appeared for the State.  Court calls case and appearances.  Atty Lawton offers a plea questionaire and waiver of rights form.  Court questions the defendant re: her plea questionaire and waiver of rights form.  Def. pleas no contest.  Court continues questioning.   Court finds there is a factual basis. Court finds the def. freely and knowingly waives her rights.  Court accepts plea and finds the def. guilty. State and counsel agree that no PSI is needed.  Off record at 10:08am.  Back on record at 10:09am.  Atty Lawton speaks to the court.  State speaks to the court asking for 3 years probation.  Atty Lawton states they are in agreement with the State and asking the court to adopt the the recomendation.  Defendant speaks to the court.   Court sentences the defendant to 3 years probation. Consecutive to current probation the def. is on.  + costs.  Conditions: Any and all other conditions the DOC imposes.

records.addlTxt: Status conference at 02-25-2016 10:00 am
Waived reading. Not guilty plea is entered.

Defendant, Tenisha Ellen Irvine appeared with Attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Attorney Angeline E Winton appeared for the State. Court calls case and appearances.  Joint preliminary here w/ 15 CF 149. State vs. Tasha Irvine.  Ms. Irvine appears in person w/ Atty Michael Hoffman. State calls Sgt. Nick Helstern to the stand. Clerk swears in Sgt. Helstern. State begins questioning. Court finds the Sgt. has identifed the defendants. No futher questions from the state. Cross from Atty Moldenhauer. No further questions from Atty Moldenhauer. Cross from Atty Hoffman. No further questions.  Witness is excused. Argument from the state. No argument from Atty Moldenhauer. Argument from Atty Hoffman.
Court finds there is probable cause and both cases are bound over for trial.  Status conference scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 10:00 am.
